required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Different Implant Collar Lengths on Long-term Bone Healing
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Randomized Clinical Trial Evaluating the Effect of Different Implant Collar Lengths on Peri-Implant Bone and Soft Tissue Healing After 23-26 Years of Function With Full Arch Fixed Mandibular Prostheses

brief_summary.textblock: Brånemark System® dental implant osseointegration was introduced clinically in 1965 as a novel approach to the replacement of missing teeth. Although this implant's traditional machined screw-shaped surface had excellent, well-documented short- and long-term clinical success, newer implant designs were introduced that could enhance fusion of the implant to jaw bones and better resist functional forces. These characteristics could lead to less bone loss, according to manufacturers. One such implant, Screw-Vent®, had a macro-structure very similar to that of the Brånemark implant. However, its fixture surface was acid-etched which could enhance osseointegration, and it had a longer narrower machined internal-hex interlocking flat collar that could better resist occlusal forces. However, one clinical study had reported greater short-term bone loss with this implant compared to the Brånemark implant, possibly due to its longer machined flat collar, and had advocated long-term clinical studies. Therefore,this within-subject clinical trial was undertaken in 1993 to first compare the Brånemark implant with another implant, Swede-Vent®, a copy of the Brånemark macro-structure except for its fixture surface that was identically acid-etched as that of Screw-Vent by the same manufacturer. The effect on bone healing could then be compared between Brånemark's machined and Swede-Vent's acid-etched surfaces in the short- and long-terms. Since Screw-Vent's fixture surface was identically acid-etched as that of Swede-Vent by the same manufacturer, the investigators could then evaluate the effect on bone healing of Screw-Vent's longer, narrower machined flat collar and the identical shorter, wider machined flat collars of Swede-Vent and Brånemark. All three 2-part platform-matched parallel-wall implants were made of commercially pure titanium, had a very similar fixture macro-design, were approved by the Food and Drug Administration (USA) and Health and Welfare Canada, and were commercially available in North America. Brånemark is still available, but with an oxidized microtextured fixture surface. Screw-Vent is still available with its microtextured fixture surface. Swede-Vent is no longer available. Results obtained at the 15-20 year recall period were published, and the present study is a continuation of this within-subject clinical trial.to the 23-26 year recall.

primary_outcome.description: Distance between first bone-to-implant contact point (fBIC) and microgap (MG) placed at the crest will be measured in mm (on standardized periapical radiographs) at the right and left sides of each implant-abutment complex. Mean fBIC-MG values will be calculated, recorded and compared between B and SW, between B and SC and between SW and SC for Configuration 1(Brånemark 2, Swede-Vent 2, Screw-Vent 1), Configuration 2 (Brånemark 1, Swede-Vent 2, Screw-Vent 2), and Configuration 3 (Brånemark 2, Swede-Vent 1, Screw-Vent 2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of soft tissue healing: height of keratinized gingiva.
secondary_outcome.description: Height of the keratinized gingiva will be measured in mm using a ColorVue UNC12 Hu-Friedy probe on the buccal and lingual surfaces of the trans-epithelial abutments. Mean values will be calculated, recorded and compared between B and SW, between B and SC and between SW and SC for Configuration 1 (Brånemark 2, Swede-Vent 2, Screw-Vent 1), Configuration 2 (Brånemark 1, Swede-Vent 2, Screw-Vent 2), and Configuration 3 (Brånemark 2, Swede-Vent 1, Screw-Vent 2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of soft tissue healing: pocket depth.
secondary_outcome.description: Using a ColorVue UNC12 Hu-Friedy probe (and a light pressure of 0.25N), pocket depth will be measured in mm on the buccal, lingual, mesial and distal abutment surfaces. Mean values will be calculated, recorded and compared between B and SW, between B and SC and between SW and SC for Configuration 1(Brånemark 2, Swede-Vent 2, Screw-Vent 1), Configuration 2 (Brånemark 1, Swede-Vent 2, Screw-Vent 2), and Configuration 3 (Brånemark 2, Swede-Vent 1, Screw-Vent 2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of soft tissue healing: presence or absence of plaque and gingival bleeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Presence or absence of plaque and gingival bleeding on probing will be evaluated using the dichotomous/binary plaque index (dPI) and bleeding index (dBI). Values of 0 (none present) or 1 (present) will be recorded. All values will be compared between B and SW, between B and SC and between SW and SC for Configuration 1 (Brånemark 2, Swede-Vent 2, Screw-Vent 1), Configuration 2 (Brånemark 1, Swede-Vent 2, Screw-Vent 2), and Configuration 3 (Brånemark 2, Swede-Vent 1, Screw-Vent 2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of soft tissue healing: presence or absence of purulent exudate.
secondary_outcome.description: Presence or absence of purulent exudate on probing will be evaluated. Values of 0 (none present) or 1 (present) will be recorded. All values will be compared between B and SW, between B and SC and between SW and SC for Configuration 1 (Brånemark 2, Swede-Vent 2, Screw-Vent 1), Configuration 2 (Brånemark 1, Swede-Vent 2, Screw-Vent 2), and Configuration 3 (Brånemark 2, Swede-Vent 1, Screw-Vent 2).

other_outcome.measure: Comparison of bone healing measurement systems.
other_outcome.description: Quantitative fBIC-MG measurements in mm will be made at the right and left sides of each implant-abutment complex using standardized metallic film supports for conventional and phosphor plaque film systems. Mean fBIC-MG values will be calculated and recorded, and the results wil be compared between the 2 systems.

arm_group.description: Device placement: B (Brånemark dental implant) placed at two sites, SW (Swede-Vent dental implant) placed at two sites, SC (Screw-Vent dental implant) placed at one site.
Device placement: B (Brånemark dental implant) placed at one site, SW (Swede-Vent dental implant) placed at two sites, SC (Screw-Vent dental implant) placed at two sites.
Device placement: B (Brånemark dental implant) placed at two sites, SW (Swede-Vent dental implant) placed at one site, SC (Screw-Vent dental implant) placed at two sites.

intervention.description: Brånemark implant placed at sites 2 and 5, Swede-Vent implant placed at sites 1 and 4, Screw-Vent implant placed at site 3.
Brånemark implant placed at site 3, Swede-Vent implant placed at sites 2 and 5, Screw-Vent implant placed at sites 1 and 4.
Brånemark implant placed at sites 1 and 4, Swede-Vent implant placed at site 3, Screw-Vent implant placed at sites 2 and 5.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- non-smoker
- no temporomandibular joint (TMJ) disorder or facial pain
- having partcipated in the original study (1993 - 1996) at which time the mnimum participate age was 25 years and the maximum 56 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- refusal to sign informed consent documents.

reference.citation: Galgut P. A comparison of different indices used in the clinical assessment of plaque and gingival bleeding. Clin Oral Investig. 1999 Jun;3(2):96-9.

results_reference.citation: Camarda AJ, Milot P, Ciaburro H, Rompré PH, Sallaleh I, Do CMA. Long-term randomized clinical trial evaluating the effects of fixture surface acid-etching and machined collar design on bone healing. Quintessence Int. 2018;49(9):733-743. doi: 10.3290/j.qi.a41013.
